member.name: M:AttributeRouting.RoutePrefixAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Specify a prefix to be used before all routes defined in this controller.
member.param: The url prefix to apply to the routes

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.RouteAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Specify the route information for this action.
member.param: The url that is associated with this action
The httpMethod against which to constrain the route

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.RouteAttribute.Url
member.summary: The url for this action.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.RouteAttribute.HttpMethod
member.summary: The HttpMethod this route is constrained against.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.RouteAttribute.Order
member.summary: The order of this route among all the routes defined against this action.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.RouteAttribute.Precedence
member.summary: The order of this route among all the routes defined against this controller.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.RouteAttribute.RouteName
member.summary: The name this route will be registered with in the RouteTable.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.RouteAttribute.IsAbsoluteUrl
member.summary: If true, the generated route url will be applied from the root, skipping any relevant area name or route prefix.

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.DELETEAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Specify a route for this action constrained to requests providing an httpMethod value of DELETE.
member.param: The url that is associated with this action

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.RouteCollectionExtensions.MapAttributeRoutes(System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection)
member.summary: Scans the calling assembly for all routes defined with AttributeRouting attributes, using the default conventions.

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.RouteCollectionExtensions.MapAttributeRoutes(System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection,System.Action{AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfiguration})
member.summary: Scans the specified assemblies for all routes defined with AttributeRouting attributes, and applies configuration options against the routes found.
member.param: The initialization action that builds the configuration object.

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.RouteCollectionExtensions.MapAttributeRoutes(System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection,AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfiguration)
member.summary: Scans the specified assemblies for all routes defined with AttributeRouting attributes, and applies configuration options against the routes found.
member.param: The configuration object.

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfiguration.ScanAssemblyOf``1
member.summary: Scans the assembly of the specified controller for routes to register.
member.typeparam: The controller type used to specify the assembly

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfiguration.ScanAssembly(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Scans the specified assembly for routes to register.
member.param: The assembly

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfiguration.AddRoutesFromControllersOfType``1
member.summary: Adds all the routes for all the controllers that derive from the specified controller to the end of the route collection.

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfiguration.AddRoutesFromController``1
member.summary: Adds all the routes for the specified controller to the end of the route collection.

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfiguration.AddTheRemainingScannedRoutes
member.summary: When using AddRoutesFromControllersOfType or AddRoutesFromController to set the precendence of the routes, you must explicitly specify that you want to include the remaining routes discoved while scanning assemblies.

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfiguration.AddDefaultRouteConstraint(System.String,System.Web.Routing.IRouteConstraint)
member.summary: Automatically applies the specified constaint against url parameters with names that match the given regular expression.
member.param: The regex used to match url parameter names
The constraint to apply to matched parameters

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfiguration.UseLowercaseRoutes
member.summary: When true, the generated routes will produce lowercase outbound URLs. The default is false.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfiguration.AutoGenerateRouteNames
member.summary: When true, the generated routes will have auto-generated route names in the form controller_action. The default is false.

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.RegexRouteConstraint.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Applies a regex constraint against the associated url parameter.

member.summary: Applies a regex constraint against the associated url parameter.

The RegexOptions to use when testing the url parameter value
